[et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ fullwidth=”on” custom_padding_last_edited=”on|desktop” _builder_version=”4.9.4″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”#F2F2F2″ custom_padding_tablet=”” custom_padding_phone=”” global_module=”1664″ saved_tabs=”all”][et_pb_fullwidth_header title=”@ET-DC@eyJkeW5hbWljIjp0cnVlLCJjb250ZW50IjoicG9zdF90aXRsZSIsInNldHRpbmdzIjp7ImJlZm9yZSI6IiIsImFmdGVyIjoiIn19@” module_class=”fp-page-header” _builder_version=”4.9.4″ _dynamic_attributes=”title,background_image” _module_preset=”default” title_font=”|300|||||||” title_font_size=”90px” content_link_text_color=”#FFFFFF” background_enable_color=”off” use_background_color_gradient=”on” background_color_gradient_start=”rgba(0,0,0,0)” background_color_gradient_end=”rgba(0,0,0,0.78)” background_color_gradient_start_position=”60%” background_color_gradient_overlays_image=”on” background_image=”@ET-DC@eyJkeW5hbWljIjp0cnVlLCJjb250ZW50IjoicG9zdF9mZWF0dXJlZF9pbWFnZSIsInNldHRpbmdzIjp7fX0=@” min_height=”600px” min_height_tablet=”420px” min_height_phone=”200px” min_height_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_padding_tablet=”” custom_padding_phone=”||20px||false|false” custom_padding_last_edited=”on|phone” title_font_size_tablet=”50px” title_font_size_phone=”32px” title_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone” text_shadow_style=”preset3″ content_link_text_color__hover_enabled=”on|hover” content_link_text_color__hover=”#FEC357″]
[/et_pb_fullwidth_header][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ _builder_version=”4.9.1″ _module_preset=”default”][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_2,1_2″ _builder_version=”4.9.1″ _module_preset=”default”][et_pb_column type=”1_2″ _builder_version=”4.9.1″ _module_preset=”default”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.9.4″ _module_preset=”default”]

Family Promise Union County (FPUC) is the flagship program of the national office and the first Affiliate established in the national network.

The need for shelter and comprehensive support services in Union County only increased during the pandemic. In 2020, Union County:

    • Launched the second year of a shelter diversion initiative supported by the Union County Commissioners
    • Delivered over 7,500 nights of shelter
    • Secured permanent and temporary housing for families
    • Served over 10,000 meals
    • Offered back-rent assistance to prevent homelessness and forward-going rent to move families out of homelessness
    • Worked with over 100 landlords in Union County
    • Engaged volunteers to provide services in financial capabilities, health and wellness, tutoring and more!

FPUC provides meaningful opportunities for people to make a difference in the lives of families in their community and empowers families to maintain employment, housing, and hope.

 

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_2″ _builder_version=”4.9.1″ _module_preset=”default”][et_pb_image src=”https://familypromise.org/wp-content/uploads/2021/05/FPUC1.jpg” alt=”Family Promise Union County” title_text=”FPUC” _builder_version=”4.9.2″ _module_preset=”default”][/et_pb_image][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ _builder_version=”4.9.2″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”#F2F2F2″][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_2,1_2″ make_equal=”on” _builder_version=”4.9.2″ _module_preset=”default”][et_pb_column type=”1_2″ _builder_version=”4.9.2″ _module_preset=”default”][et_pb_blurb title=”Bridge to Success” url=”https://familypromise.org/what-we-do/fp-union-county/bridge-to-success/” image=”https://familypromise.org/wp-content/uploads/2021/05/FPUC-Workshops-1.jpg” alt=”Family Promise Union County workshops” _builder_version=”4.9.4″ _module_preset=”a693ea36-2f41-46b9-a727-d5d3b27be1db” link_option_url=”https://familypromise.org/what-we-do/fp-union-county/bridge-to-success/”]

FPUC’s Bridge to Success program creates opportunities for families to reclaim their independence. It provides comprehensive services targeted at helping them rebuild their lives and focus on the future.
READ MORE >

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_2″ _builder_version=”4.9.2″ _module_preset=”default”][et_pb_blurb title=”FPUC Volunteer Training” url=”https://volunteer.familypromise.org/” image=”https://familypromise.org/wp-content/uploads/2021/05/cranford-scouts-fpuc.jpg” alt=”Scouts volunteer with FPUC” _builder_version=”4.9.4″ _module_preset=”a693ea36-2f41-46b9-a727-d5d3b27be1db” link_option_url=”https://volunteer.familypromise.org/”]

Join us at one of our volunteer events to learn more about Family Promise and how you can get involved.  Upcoming dates to be added soon.
READ MORE >

[/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ _builder_version=”4.9.2″ _module_preset=”default”][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.9.2″ _module_preset=”default” custom_margin=”||||false|false” custom_padding=”|20%|||false|false” locked=”off”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.9.2″ _module_preset=”default”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.9.2″ _module_preset=”default” custom_padding=”||20px||false|false”]

Volunteer Opportunities with FPUC

Claire Boylan, Rental Assistance Coordinator

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column_inner][et_pb_column_inner type=”1_2″ saved_specialty_column_type=”1_2″ _builder_version=”4.9.4″ _module_preset=”default”][et_pb_image src=”https://familypromise.org/wp-content/uploads/2021/05/SuburbanChamberOfCommerce-Summit-150×150.jpeg” title_text=”SuburbanChamberOfCommerce-Summit” _builder_version=”4.9.2″ _module_preset=”default”][/et_pb_image][/et_pb_column_inner][/et_pb_row_inner][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ disabled_on=”on|on|on” _builder_version=”4.9.2″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”#F2F2F2″ disabled=”on”][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.9.2″ _module_preset=”default” custom_padding=”||1px|||” locked=”off”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.9.2″ _module_preset=”default”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.9.2″ _module_preset=”default”]

FPUC Community Board

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.9.2″ _module_preset=”default” locked=”off”]The Family Promise Union County (FPUC) Community Board serves to further the interests of guest families, congregations, volunteers, and community partners of Family Promise Union County. The Community Board is a key component in FPUC’s comprehensive approach to addressing family homelessness. The board is comprised of community leaders, and provides an additional voice, advocacy, and assistance for the program by making connections locally that lead to increased opportunities for families, additional fundraising streams, and the formation and strengthening of individual programs. Their function can be described as a combination of ombudsman, “kitchen cabinet,” and fund development committee.[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_4,1_4,1_4,1_4″ _builder_version=”4.9.2″ _module_preset=”default” locked=”off”][et_pb_column type=”1_4″ _builder_version=”4.9.2″ _module_preset=”default”][et_pb_fp_person name=”Rev. Jane McCready” image_url=”https://familypromise.org/wp-content/uploads/2021/05/Pastor-Jane-McCready.jpg” modal_content=”Jane is chair of the FPUC Community Board, and Pastor at Faith Lutheran Church, New Providence, where she has been a member since 1996. Pastor Jane and her husband Gary lived in Westfield for 20 years where they raised their family, and currently reside in New Providence, where she is an active community volunteer. She also serves as Chair of the New Providence-Berkeley Heights Interfaith Clergy Group; Chair, First Contact and Coordinator of the New Providence-Berkeley Heights Community Emergency Group; and is a member of The New Jersey Synod Mission Advocacy Table in Trenton. She has a B.A. from Indiana University in Bloomington, Indiana and received her Master of Divinity from The Lutheran Theological Seminary at Philadelphia. Prior to attending Seminary, Pastor Jane worked in New York City for the 55th Street Dance Theater Foundation at City Center Theater and as a Legal Assistant. ” _builder_version=”4.9.2″ _module_preset=”default” background_enable_color=”off”][/et_pb_fp_person][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_4″ _builder_version=”4.9.2″ _module_preset=”default”][et_pb_fp_person name=”Shonda Brooks” image_url=”https://familypromise.org/wp-content/uploads/2021/05/Shonda-Brooks.jpg” modal_content=”Shonda is the founder of The Need2Read Program, Inc., which offers a weekly literacy program to youth in the homeless community. Formerly an early childhood educator, she has incorporated both life-long and professional skills and experiences into educating youth and working with families. As an author and educator, literacy through reading and writing are at the core of her desire to grow young minds and foster the development of young adults. Shonda resides in Scotch Plains, New Jersey with her husband and three children. She is active in her church, Kingdom Life Cathedral of Scotch Plains, NJ, where her husband is the pastor and she serves as both worship and youth leader. She holds an Associate of Applied Science in Business, a Bachelor of Arts in Psychology, a Master of Arts in Human Services Counseling with a focus in Christian Ministries, and is currently on the licensure track for the field of counseling by completing her second master’s degree in Professional Counseling. ” _builder_version=”4.9.2″ _module_preset=”default” background_enable_color=”off”][/et_pb_fp_person][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_4″ _builder_version=”4.9.2″ _module_preset=”default”][et_pb_fp_person name=”Nikki Griffiths” image_url=”https://familypromise.org/wp-content/uploads/2021/05/Nicole-Griffiths.jpg” modal_content=”Nikki serves as Administrative Assistant to the Summit Chief of Police. In addition to her full time job, Nikki also works as a dispatcher with the Mountain Valley Emergency Communications Center. She graduated from Raritan Valley Community College with an Associate of Arts Degree in Criminal Justice and is currently completing courses for a Bachelor’s Degree in Biology and Environmental Science. Nikki joined the Family Promise Union County Community Board in 2015 and has participated in many events that are hosted for the families served by the program. She has been running a food and household item collection for the past three years in conjunction with the Summit Police Department to benefit Family Promise, each year consistently doubling the previous year’s collections. She joined the Junior League of Summit Board in 2016 and has previously been a member of the Summit Volunteer First Aid Squad; serving almost eight years with the other members assisting the residents in Summit and surrounding communities. During her down time, Nikki enjoys taking her dogs hiking to different state parks, reading, and spending time with family and friends.” _builder_version=”4.9.2″ _module_preset=”default” background_enable_color=”off”][/et_pb_fp_person][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_4″ _builder_version=”4.9.2″ _module_preset=”default”][et_pb_fp_person name=”Kevin Hill” image_url=”https://familypromise.org/wp-content/uploads/2021/05/kevin-hill.jpg” modal_content=”Kevin is the Chief Operating Officer of The Leaguers Inc., a federally funded agency with a focus on Early Childhood Education and has been appointed Vice President Corporate Relations and External Affairs for Berkeley College. In addition to his community board seat at Family Promise, he serves on the Board of Managers for the Summit area YMCA. Kevin is also Vice Chairman of the Lena Willis endowment fund, also located in Summit, New Jersey. He is a member of the National Omicron Honor Society and is a frequent lecturer on Strategic Planning, Organizational Leadership and Development. Kevin holds a B.S. in Organizational Management and Master of Science degree in Organizational Leadership.” _builder_version=”4.9.2″ _module_preset=”default” background_enable_color=”off” locked=”off”][/et_pb_fp_person][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_4,1_4,1_4,1_4″ _builder_version=”4.9.2″ _module_preset=”default” locked=”off”][et_pb_column type=”1_4″ _builder_version=”4.9.2″ _module_preset=”default”][et_pb_fp_person name=”Dr. Christina Johnson” image_url=”https://familypromise.org/wp-content/uploads/2021/05/Christina-Johnson.jpg” modal_content=”Dr. Johnson is a Physician at Maplewood Family Medicine and is on faculty at Overlook Family Medicine. Born and raised in Philadelphia, PA, she is an honors graduate of Ursinus College. She is a board-certified Family Medicine physician who completed her family medicine residency at Overlook Medical Center in Summit, NJ, upon graduating from the Howard University College of Medicine. She also earned her doctorate in Microbiology at Howard University. Her professional interests include preventive medicine, community medicine, and primary care research. She has served on the community board of Family Promise Union County since 2016, where she has helped to develop a longitudinal health education curriculum and to organize a biannual community health fair. She is actively involved on the Overlook Hospital Community Health committee and regularly performs health screenings in the area. In her spare time, she enjoys spending time with her family and loves to learn about art and music.” _builder_version=”4.9.2″ _module_preset=”default” background_enable_color=”off”][/et_pb_fp_person][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_4″ _builder_version=”4.9.2″ _module_preset=”default”][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_4″ _builder_version=”4.9.2″ _module_preset=”default”][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_4″ _builder_version=”4.9.2″ _module_preset=”default”][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section]

@graph.name: Family Promise
@graph.description: Transforming the lives of families experiencing homelessness.
